task_summary: Robot arm places a visible blue pot from the counter into the adjacent sink following a sequential grasp-transport-place policy.

task_long_description.overview: The robot arm operates within a compact kitchen mockup, aiming to transfer a visible blue pot from the counter surface into the sink. The workspace includes a stovetop, sink, and cabinetry, with the pot placed near the sink. The robot must locate the pot, grasp it using a side strategy, move above the sink, and release the pot onto the sink surface. Visual detection and stable grasping are prerequisites; failures require rescan attempts. The system prioritizes object-centric manipulation with safety and gentle contact force.
preconditions: Pot is present and visually discernible on the counter.
Gripper is initially open and the robot is operational.
Workspace is free of obstructing objects.
stepwise_plan: Visually locate pot; retry scan if needed.
Move above the pot and compute grasp pose (side strategy).
Approach, lower until gentle contact detected, and close gripper.
Locate sink and ensure it is visible.
Move above sink and align for placement.
Place pot on sink surface and open gripper.
Retreat and wait briefly to confirm stability.
success_criteria: Pot is stably placed in the sink area.
No collision or object drop occurs.
All steps complete without error or timeout.
failure_and_recovery: If pot not found, retry scan (up to 3 attempts).
If grasp fails, repeat approach and regrasp.
If sink occluded, perform detection again.
Abort if critical errors or persistent visibility failures.
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when pot is released and the arm has retreated after placement.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: place the pot in the sink

node_specs.description: Checks if the pot is visible to the vision system.
Performs a scanning pattern to locate the pot.
Runs a precise pot detection routine.
Opens gripper to preset width for pre-grasp.
Moves end effector above the pot with a small vertical offset.
Calculates optimal grasp on side of pot.
Approaches pot with tight alignment tolerance.
Lowers pot until gentle contact force is detected.
Closes gripper to grasp pot with low/moderate force.
Checks if current grasp is stable before lifting.
Checks that sink is visible in sensor view.
Places pot gently on sink surface.
Opens gripper to release pot after placement.
Retracts end effector after placing pot.
Waits briefly to confirm completion and stability.

failure_modes: Sink not visible or detection failed
recovery_strategy: Trigger scan fallback for visibility failures
Retry grasp approach and closure if instability detected
Abort on persistent errors after retries
assumptions: No conflicting objects in sink or pot path in frames
Pot is grasped via side strategy based on its orientation in all frames (not top)
Instruction matches actual sequence observed â€” no direct evidence of obstructions or competing goals
Pot is in stable position before and after transfer, as per frames

expected_success_criteria: Pot lies entirely within sink area after placement
